definitions.usage: 作为形容词，表示某行为或决定是经过仔细思考或计划后有意为之，通常带有谨慎或目的性。

examples.scene: 在一场重要的公司会议中，团队需要决定是否启动一个高风险的新项目。经理在分析了所有数据后，提出了一个明确的计划。
examples.chineseIdea: 经理在深思熟虑后，决定采取一个明确的策略，以确保项目的成功。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The manager’s @ @ to launch the project was based on thorough analysis.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The manager’s 「deliberate attempt」 to launch the project was based on thorough analysis.
examples.chineseTranslation: 经理「深思熟虑的尝试」启动项目是基于详尽的分析。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The manager very carefully try to launch the project. 纠正：The manager made a deliberate attempt to launch the project.

examples.scene: 一位学生在选择大学专业时，面对多种选项，经过数周的思考和咨询，最终选择了计算机科学。
examples.chineseIdea: 学生在权衡利弊后，谨慎地选择了一个适合自己未来发展的专业。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Her @ @ of computer science reflected her long-term career goals.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Her 「deliberate choice」 of computer science reflected her long-term career goals.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她「深思熟虑的选择」计算机科学反映了她的长期职业目标。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：She choose computer science very carefully. 纠正：Her deliberate choice of computer science was well-considered.

definitions.usage: 作为形容词，描述动作或行为缓慢、谨慎，通常带有一种从容不迫的感觉。

examples.scene: 在一个安静的艺术画廊中，一位参观者在每幅画前停留许久，仔细观察细节，步伐缓慢而平稳。
examples.chineseIdea: 参观者不急不躁，慢慢地欣赏每幅画，展现出一种从容的态度。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: He walked through the gallery at a @ @, absorbing every detail.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: He walked through the gallery at a 「deliberate pace」, absorbing every detail.
examples.chineseTranslation: 他以「缓慢而谨慎的步伐」穿过画廊，细细品味每一个细节。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：He walk very slow in the gallery. 纠正：He walked at a deliberate pace through the gallery.

examples.scene: 在一场公开演讲中，演讲者用缓慢而清晰的语调向听众传达复杂的信息，确保每个人都能理解。
examples.chineseIdea: 演讲者通过从容的语调，让听众更容易理解复杂的概念。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: She spoke in a @ @ to ensure clarity for the audience.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: She spoke in a 「deliberate tone」 to ensure clarity for the audience.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她以「缓慢而谨慎的语调」讲话，以确保听众能够清楚理解。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：She speak very slow to make clear. 纠正：She spoke in a deliberate tone to ensure clarity.

definitions.usage: 作为动词，表示仔细思考或讨论某事，通常用于正式或法律场景，强调深思熟虑的过程。

examples.scene: 在一个法庭案件中，陪审团在做出最终判决前，需要花时间讨论所有证据。
examples.chineseIdea: 陪审团需要认真分析证据，以确保判决的公正性。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The jury took hours to @ @ the evidence before reaching a verdict.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The jury took hours to 「deliberate on」 the evidence before reaching a verdict.
examples.chineseTranslation: 陪审团花了数小时「慎重考虑」证据，然后才做出判决。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The jury think about the evidence for hours. 纠正：The jury deliberated on the evidence for hours.

examples.scene: 一个城市规划委员会在决定是否批准一项新的建筑项目时，召开了多次会议进行讨论。
examples.chineseIdea: 委员会需要反复讨论项目的可行性，以确保决策的合理性。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The committee will @ @ the proposal for weeks before deciding.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The committee will 「deliberate over」 the proposal for weeks before deciding.
examples.chineseTranslation: 委员会将「慎重考虑」提案数周，然后再做决定。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The committee discuss the proposal very long time. 纠正：The committee will deliberate over the proposal for weeks.
